member.name: T:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.AgentHelpRequest
member.summary: This class represents an agent's request for help from a supervisor.
member.remarks:
Agents sometimes need to obtain help with an interaction. For example, an agent might request help when a caller asks a question that the agent cannot answer.
When the request is sent, all supervisors of the workgroup from which the call originated receive an assistance request stating that the agent needs help. When one supervisor accepts the assistance request, the request is automatically dismissed from all other supervisors' IC systems.
Objects of this class contain data about an a agent's help request. These data items (agent, problem description, station, extension, etc.) are sent to the supervisor and are returned in the object when the supervisor responds.

member.summary: This class represents a supervisor's response to an agent's help request.
member.remarks:
This class provides support for sending a response to an agent's supervisor help request.
To send a response to a help request call or providing the object and a flag indicating whether the supervisor will help. When the asynchronous send-response operation completes, it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
The asynchronous version of the method is preferred since sending a response can be a lengthy operation.

member.name: T:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.CallbackInteraction
member.summary: Represents a callback interaction within the Interaction Center system. Callback interactions occur when agents call a customer in accordance with a callback request.
member.remarks:
To set a callback request to completed, call either the or the methods and provide a boolean to indicate success or failure. When the asynchronous method returns it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
Calling properties on this object without a watch in place raises the .
The asynchronous methods are preferred since the stop completion task can be lengthy.

member.name: T:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.Interaction
member.summary: Represents an Interaction within the Interaction Center system.
member.remarks:
Interactions in the Interaction Center system can be calls, chats, emails, email, monitors, or recordings.
This class allows you to start, stop, and change watches on interaction attributes along with interaction control actions such as pickup, hold, disconnect, park, etc.
To start watching interaction attributes, call or passing in an array of attribute names to watch (For built in attributes see ). When the asynchronous start watching completes it invokes the specified delegate.
To stop watching interaction attributes, call or . When the asynchronous stop watch action completes, it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To change the interaction attributes to watch, call or . When the asynchronous change watched attributes action completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
Calling or when a watch is in place or , , , or when a watch is not in place raises an .
Accessing interaction properties when a watch is not in place raises a .
To retrieve the value of a Boolean attribute call or and provide an attribute name. When the asynchronous get attribute operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate returning the value of this attribute.
To retrieve the value of a integer attribute call or and provide an attribute name. When the asynchronous get attribute operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate returning the value of this attribute.
To retrieve the value of a string attribute call or and provide an attribute name. When the asynchronous get attribute operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate returning the value of this attribute.
To retrieve the value of a attribute call or and provide an attribute name. When the asynchronous get attribute operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate returning the value of this attribute.
To set the value of a attribute call or . When the set attribute value completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To set the value of a string attribute call or . When the set attribute value completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To append a value to a string attribute call or and provide the string to append to the attribute value. When the append operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To perform a Pickup operation on an interaction, call or . When the asynchronous Pickup operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To perform a Disconnect operation on an interaction, call or . When the asynchronous Disconnect operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To perform a Hold operation on an interaction, call or . When the asynchronous Hold operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To perform a Record operation on an interaction, call or . When the asynchronous Record operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To perform a BlindTransfer operation on an interaction, call BlindTransfer or BlindTransferAsync. When the asynchronous BlindTransfer operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To perform a ConsultTransfer operation on an interaction, call or . When the asynchronous ConsultTransfer operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To perform a TransferToVoicemail operation on an interaction, call TransferToVoicemail or TransferToVoicemailAsync. When the asynchronous TransferToVoicemail operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To perform a Park operation on an interaction, call Park or ParkAsync. When the asynchronous Park operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To perform a Listen operation on an interaction, call or . When the asynchronous Listen operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To perform a Coach operation on an interaction, call or . When the asynchronous Coach operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To perform a Mute operation on an interaction, call or . When the asynchronous Mute operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To perform a Pause operation on an interaction, call or . When the asynchronous Pause operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To perform a Private operation on an interaction, call or . When the asynchronous Private operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To perform a Voicemail operation on an interaction, call or . When the asynchronous Voicemail operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To perform a Join operation on an interaction, call or . When the asynchronous Join operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To perform a RequestHelp operation on an interaction, call or . When the asynchronous RequestHelp operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
The asynchronous methods are preferred since the above operations can be lengthy.

member.name: P:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.Interaction.IsShared
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this is a shared instance.
member.value: if this is a shared instance; otherwise, .

remarks.para: IceLib automatically conserves memory by maintaining a shared instance of each unique Interaction that it creates internally.
A shared instance cannot be watched. This prevents the assignment of conflicting sets of watched attributes. To watch this Interaction, create a new instance using the InteractionId.

member.name: P:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.Interaction.CallIdKey
member.summary: Gets the . CallIdKey is only available if the attribute is being watched.
member.value: The call ID key. IC generates unique IDs for each interaction in the system. These identifiers are called "Call ID" in Interaction Client, and they are modified and stored in the IC database as unique "CallIDKey" in the "Call ID" column. These identifiers apply to all interaction types, not just calls. The CallID is embedded in the CallIDKey. CallIDKey is the 10 digit CallId plus an eight digit date in this format: YYYYMMDD. For example, a call placed on April 9, 2004 might show a Call ID of 2101990183 on Interaction Client. The resulting CallIDKey stored in the database would be that CallID plus the date: 210199018320040409.
member.exception: The associated attribute is not being watched.

member.name: P:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.Interaction.AccountCodeId
member.summary: Gets the Id of the account code. AccountCodeId is only available if the attribute is being watched.
member.remarks:
Account codes are used in IC to associate calls with accounts. An account code is a number assigned to an account name. Account codes are mapped to incoming and outgoing calls for reporting purposes. For example, Interaction Client users can assign account codes to incoming and outgoing calls from the Interactions page, or from any queue.
Users who have been given access to an account code can assign it to a call so it can be tracked. Account codes can also be used to track outgoing calls made to specific customers, or to track incoming call information for billing purposes.
For more information about Account Codes, refer to the topic titled Account Codes in IC in the Technical Reference Documents section of the IC Documentation library on your server.
The account code ID can be used with an ININ.IceLib.People.AccountCode.
member.exception: The associated attribute is not being watched.

remarks.para: This can be assigned via handlers to be different than the actual workgroup name. The associated attribute to set from handlers is 'Eic_AssignedWorkgroup'.

member.name: T:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.CallInteraction
member.summary: Represents a call within the Interaction Center system.
member.remarks:
This class provides the ability to play digits, play audio, and stop all audio for the call interaction.
To play digits, call the or methods. When the asynchronous play digits operation completes, it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To play audio, call the or methods. When the asynchronous play audio operation completes, it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
The asynchronous methods are preferred since the above operations can be lengthy.

member.name: T:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.ChatInteraction
member.summary: Represents a chat within the Interaction Center system.
member.remarks:
Chat interactions allow users to interact by sending and receiving text, files, or URLs.
To start watching a chat interaction call or . When the asynchronous chat start watch completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To stop watching a chat interaction call or . When the asynchronous chat stop watch completes, it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To add members to the chat call or providing an array of for all members to add to this chat. When the asynchronous add members operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To set an indicator to the members that a member is typing call the or providing a flag to indicate if the typing indicator is visible or not. When the asynchronous set typing indicator operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To send text to members of this chat, call the or methods with the text to send. When the asynchronous send text operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To send a URL to the chat members, call the or methods. When the asynchronous send URL operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To send a file to chat members call or . When the asynchronous send file operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
Calling ChatStartWatching or ChatStartWatchingAsync when a watch is already in place, or calling ChatStopWatching or ChatStartWatchingAsync when a watch is not in place raises an .
The asynchronous versions of the above methods are preferred since they can be lengthy operations.

member.name: T:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.ConsultTransfer
member.summary: Represents a consult transfer between a caller, agent, and consult.
member.remarks: An agent may seek to transfer a caller to a consult as part of an interaction. The agent would first make the consult transfer, which will allow the agent to speak to either the caller, the consult, or both. The agent may conclude the consult transfer by either completing the transfer, resulting in the caller speaking to the consult. Alternatively, the agent may cancel the transfer, resulting in the caller speaking with the agent.

member.name: T:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.ChatMember
member.summary: Represents a member (person participating) in a .
member.remarks: Chat interactions in IC allow users to send and receive text, files, or URLs. Chat members have a type (usually internal or external), a display name, an associated interaction ID, and a typing indicator. There is also an explicit "System Member" that represents the IC system chat text.

member.summary: Gets the unique identifier for this entry.

member.name: P:ININ.IceLib.EFaq.EFaqEntry.Grade
member.summary: Gets the grade for this entry, describing how well it matched the query.

remarks.para: The grade of a result is used to determine how well a Question / Answer pair matches the query. Setting the minimum grade higher will generally yield fewer results. The valid range is 1.0 to 10.0. Only entries with grades above the specified in the query will be returned.
When more than one entry is returned, e-FAQ uses the matching grade to rank the results so that they can be presented in the order of the highest score first.

In the case of a tie, the order the entries actually get returned is undefined. Thus, it is theoretically possible that two entries might get exactly the same score and one would get returned and not the other. (For example, if a query had specified that only up to 3 entries be returned and there was a tie for third place, one entry would get left out of the result set, even though its score was the same as the other 3rd place entry.)

The only exception to all of this is entries that are returned because they contained a "guaranteed hit" keyword. All of these are returned, no matter what. (So, even if the query specified only to return up to 5 entries, if 7 entries were guaranteed-hits, then 7 entries will be returned.)

member.name: P:ININ.IceLib.EFaq.EFaqEntry.Question
member.summary: Gets the question portion of this entry.
member.remarks: E-FAQ entries can contain embedded HTML tags. will retain the HTML tags and whitespace, whereas will attempt to render the entry's HTML and whitespace to a text-only version.

member.name: P:ININ.IceLib.EFaq.EFaqEntry.QuestionAsPlainText
member.summary: Gets the question portion of this entry, rendered as plain text.
member.remarks: E-FAQ entries can contain embedded HTML tags. will retain the HTML tags and whitespace, whereas will attempt to render the entry's HTML and whitespace to a text-only version.

member.name: P:ININ.IceLib.EFaq.EFaqEntry.Answer
member.summary: Gets the answer portion of this entry.
member.remarks: E-FAQ entries can contain embedded HTML tags. will retain the HTML tags and whitespace, whereas will attempt to render the entry's HTML and whitespace to a text-only version.

member.summary: Gets the answer portion of this entry, rendered as plain text.

member.name: P:ININ.IceLib.EFaq.EFaqQueryOptions.MinimumGrade
member.summary: Gets the minimum grade allowed for an entry.
member.remarks: The grade of a result is used to determine how well a Question / Answer pair matches the query. Setting the minimum grade higher will generally yield fewer results. The valid range is 1.0 to 10.0. The default is 2.5.

member.name: P:ININ.IceLib.EFaq.EFaqQueryOptions.ScoreThreshold
member.summary: Gets score threshold.
member.remarks: The e-FAQ engine uses the score threshold to determine how many words in a Question / Answer pair must match words from the query text. If the score threshold is 0, no matches will be cut based on this criteria. The value must be greater than or equal to 0.0. The default is 1.0. A score threshold of 2.0 is considered strict, and few results will be returned.

member.name: T:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.EmailInteraction
member.summary: Represents an email within the Interaction Center system.
member.remarks:
This class can be used to start and stop watches on an email interaction along with downloading, uploading, and deleting attachments, and sending email messages.
To start a watch, call or . When the email start watch operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate. To stop watching an email interaction call or . When the email stop watch operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To create a new email, call .
To create a response to this email, call or with an object. To create an object for response, use the source content's . When the asynchronous set response operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To download a file attachment from the server call or providing an object and a local path to save the attachment. When the asynchronous download attachment operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To download a message attachment from the server call or providing an object. When the asynchronous download attachment operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To upload a file attachment to the server call or providing a file name of the attachment to upload. When the asynchronous upload operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To upload an inline file attachment to the server call or providing a file name of the attachment to upload and the Content-ID used to identify the attachment within the HTML body of the email. Use to create a unique Content-ID that can be used when uploading the given file as an inline attachment.
To remove a file attachment call or with an object to be removed. When the asynchronous operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To send an email, call or . When the asynchronous send operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
Calling or when a watch is already in place, or calling or when a watch is not in place raises and .
The asynchronous version of these methods is preferred since these operations can be lengthy. This class has been updated for 4.0 to replace the EmailResponse with with expanded functionality.

member.name: T:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.EmailResolver
member.summary: Allows resolving Email addresses within the Interaction Center system.
member.remarks:
This class takes a string containing a full or partial Email address and the IC server resolves it into an array of objects.
To resolve an Email address string, pass it to the or methods. When the asynchronous resolve name operation completes it invokes the completedCallback delegate. When the server has finished resolving the Email address it triggers the event. The resolved email addresses are returned in the object of this event.

member.name: T:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.GetAttributeCompletedEventArgs`1
member.summary: Provides data for the completedCallback delegate of , , , and events of a .
member.remarks:
An interaction attribute is a piece of information about an interaction that travels with it throughout the Interaction Center. For example, Telephone calls, chat sessions, Emails, and generic objects are entities in IC that have some type of attribute associated with them. Attributes can be created by a variety of entities, including the Interaction Center itself. For example, the Telephony Services subsystem creates default call object attributes when a call object is established. Handlers, IC applications, and programs developed using APIs can create and modify attributes.
Attributes are name/value pairs. To retrieve the value of an attribute, you must know its attribute name. The value of an attribute is usually string data. However, chat and call attributes can contain 32-bit binary data in DWORD format. Email objects return data that is stored in Interaction Designers list variable format.
Attribute names are not case-sensitive. "Eic_StationName" "eic_stationname" refer to the same attribute.
Attributes names that begin with Eic_ are primarily used by Interaction Client to display information about an object.
Attributes whose name does not begin with Eic_ are primarily used by handlers or chat objects.
Attributes whose name ends with "Raw" contain original, unprocessed values. These attributes are logged for reporting purposes.
Directory Services "attributes" are not the same as interaction attributes discussed here. A Directory Services attribute is an item of information that is stored in Directory Services as a registry key. Interaction attributes are name/value pairs that travel with an object as it is processed by the Interaction Center server.
For more information about attributes, see Interaction Attributes Reference Guide in the System APIs section of the IC Documentation library on your IC server.

member.name: T:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.GetStringAttributesCompletedEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the completedCallback delegate of events of a .
member.remarks:
An interaction attribute is a piece of information about an interaction that travels with it throughout the Interaction Center. For example, Telephone calls, chat sessions, Emails, and generic objects are entities in IC that have some type of attribute associated with them. Attributes can be created by a variety of entities, including the Interaction Center itself. For example, the Telephony Services subsystem creates default call object attributes when a call object is established. Handlers, IC applications, and programs developed using APIs can create and modify attributes.
Attributes are name/value pairs. To retrieve the value of an attribute, you must know its attribute name. The value of an attribute is usually string data. However, chat and call attributes can contain 32-bit binary data in DWORD format. Email objects return data that is stored in Interaction Designers list variable format.
Attribute names are not case-sensitive. "Eic_StationName" "eic_stationname" refer to the same attribute.
Attributes names that begin with Eic_ are primarily used by Interaction Client to display information about an object.
Attributes whose name does not begin with Eic_ are primarily used by handlers or chat objects.
Attributes whose name ends with "Raw" contain original, unprocessed values. These attributes are logged for reporting purposes.
Directory Services "attributes" are not the same as interaction attributes discussed here. A Directory Services attribute is an item of information that is stored in Directory Services as a registry key. Interaction attributes are name/value pairs that travel with an object as it is processed by the Interaction Center server.
For more information about attributes, see Interaction Attributes Reference Guide in the System APIs section of the IC Documentation library on your IC server.

member.name: T:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.InteractionConference
member.summary: Represents a conference within the Interaction Center system.
member.remarks:
An interaction conference occurs when multiple parties are participating in the same interaction. This class provides support for representing an interaction conference and for adding and listing parties in the interaction.
To add parties to an interaction, call or providing an array of objects. When the asynchronous add parties operation completes, it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To get the parties of a conference interaction, call or . When the asynchronous get parties operation completes, it invokes the completedCallback delegate returning the list of interactions in the object.
The asynchronous version of the above methods is preferred since these operations can be lengthy.

member.name: T:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.InteractionQueue
member.summary: Represents a queue of Interactions within the Interaction Center system.
member.remarks:
This class provides support for setting up watches and retrieving the contents of an interaction queue.
To start a watch on an interaction queue, call or and provide and array of attributes. When the asynchronous start watch operation completes, it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To stop a watch on an interaction queue, call or . When the asynchronous stop watch operation completes, it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To change the attributes watched, call or . When the asynchronous change watch operation completes, it invokes the completedCallback delegate.
To retrieve the contents of an interaction queue, call or . When the asynchronous get contents operation completes, it invokes the completedCallback delegate and returns the object containing the contents of the interaction queue. The queue contents is represented by a collection of objects.
Calling or when a watch is in place or , , , or when a watch is not in place raises an .
The asynchronous version of the above methods is preferred since these operations can be lengthy.
member.exception: The Session does not have a valid connection.

member.name: E:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.InteractionQueue.NotificationsSuspendedChanged
member.summary: Occurs when notifications on this have been temporarily suspended by the Interaction Center Server.
member.remarks:
This event will only occur if the is being watched. To start watching the queue call either the method or the method. All event handlers should be added before calling or .
If the property is set to , then all notifications will be suspended for this (with exception to additional notifications). A notification, or the appropriate notifications will also be fired to notify of the removal of the current interactions. It is not necessary to stop the watch on the queue at this time.
If the property is set to , then all notifications will be resumed for this . A notification, or the appropriate notifications will also be fired to notify of the current contents of the queue.

member.name: T:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.InteractionsHistory
member.summary: Provides access to interaction history information for a user.
member.remarks:
The class provides access to historical information about the user's interactions, such as the begin time and remote number. See for a complete explanation of the data provided.
Currently only call-specific interaction history is supported.
When the interactions history is being watched, the class will notify the client application of any changes to the history records via registered event handlers. The data is also accessible through the property.

members.member:
Queries phone number details.
The phone numbers. A array. A parameter is . A parameter contains an invalid value. The Session does not have a valid connection. The Session has been disposed. .
The arguments to this method can be phone numbers without any formatting, not fully specified phone numbers, etc. If the phone number string requires matching, pattern matching engine is invoked in an attempt to try to resolve (recognize) it. Part of the resolving process is to generate a new input number, which is the result of the Input Conversion mapping step. This new number will will overwrite the data member holding the original input number. Whether or not a match is found, the input number will be prepared by having white space and formatting characters removed and alphas mapped to digits; the exceptions to this are SIP numbers, which only have white space characters removed.
For more information please refer to .

member.name: T:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.InteractionState
member.summary: Specifies constants indicating the state of an Interaction.

member.name: F:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.InteractionState.None
member.summary: The Interaction is in an indeterminate state.

member.name: F:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.InteractionState.Alerting
member.summary: A user is being notified that he or she has an incoming interaction. This state applies to inbound interactions.

member.name: F:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.InteractionState.Connected
member.summary: Both parties are connected and are able to speak with each other. This state applies to inbound and outbound interactions.

member.name: F:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.InteractionState.Held
member.summary: The interaction is on hold. This state applies to inbound and outbound interactions.

member.name: F:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.InteractionState.Messaging
member.summary: The caller is leaving a voice mail message.

member.name: F:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.InteractionState.Offering
member.summary: The interaction has been placed in a queue, but the interaction is not alerting. IC is determining if the called party is available to take the interaction. This state applies to inbound interactions only.

member.name: F:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.InteractionState.Parked
member.summary: The Interaction is parked, waiting for the recipient user to pick it up.

member.name: F:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.InteractionState.Proceeding
member.summary: The interaction is proceeding through the outside telephone network. Proceeding is used if a user has enabled Call Analysis. This state applies to outbound calls only.

member.name: F:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.InteractionState.System
member.summary: The Interaction is being processed by the system.

member.name: F:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.InteractionState.InternalDisconnect
member.summary: The Interaction has been disconnected internally and is no longer active. This state applies to inbound and outbound interactions.

member.name: F:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.InteractionState.ExternalDisconnect
member.summary: The Interaction has been disconnected externally and is no longer active. This state applies to inbound and outbound interactions.

member.name: F:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.InteractionState.Suspended
member.summary: The interaction is suspended. This state applies to inbound and outbound interactions.

member.name: T:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.MonitoredQueueAlerting
member.summary: This class provides the main interface to enable alerting on a monitored queue.
member.remarks: A monitored queue (monitored appearance) can be configured to track interactions of other users. MonitoredQueueAlerting provides an interface for enabling and disabling alerting on a monitored queue. When enabling or disabling a monitored queue, controls if the alert should be silent or if the phone should ring.

member.name: T:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.MonitorInteraction
member.summary: Represents a monitor interaction within the Interaction Center system.

remarks.para: Interactions in the Interaction Center system can be calls, chats, emails, email, monitors, or recordings. Objects of this class represent interactions in which a user is monitoring another user's interaction. These objects are part of an interaction queue watch.
remarks.note: Accessing the properties of this class when an interaction watch is not in place raises a .

summary.para: The ININ.IceLib.Interactions namespace contains classes for manipulating Interaction Center interaction queues.

There are a number of classes within the ININ.IceLib.Interactions namespace that provide support to the classes mentioned in the preceding summary. Example of the supporting classes are enumerations, event argument classes, and delegates used by events within classes.

Queue Watches. There are a number of object classes that are used to get specific attributes for the Interactions contained in a given Interaction Queue. They are watched, meaning, that any time an attribute is changed, the internal cache of that object is kept up to date so anytime that attribute's property is referenced the current value will be returned. An event notification is available when any of the attributes changes in value.
summary.note: If the entire contents of an InteractionQueue is to be watched, Queue watches are more efficient than having individual Interaction watches on each Interaction in the Queue.
summary.para: Interaction Watches. There are a number of object classes that are used to get specific attributes for a given Interaction. They are watched, meaning, that any time an attribute is changed, the internal cache of that object is kept up to date so anytime that attribute's property is referenced the current value will be returned. An event notification is available when any of the attributes changes in value. All such objects inherit from . Examples of Interaction classes are: , , and .

Interaction Conferences. The object provides information about a conference of interactions. Additionally, the object provides support for watching attribute changes for Interactions within conferences contained on an interaction queue.
The ININ.IceLib.EFaq namespace provides classes for accessing the e-FAQ Frequently Asked Question database.

To obtain a list of e-FAQ servers and their respective FAQ Topics, use the class. This class provides access to the objects that correspond to the e-FAQ servers to which the user has been granted access persmission. Queries can then be issued to each server via the method, or the corresponding asynchronous method, on the object.

members.member:
Detailed information about a phone number within the Interaction Center system.
This class contains detailed information about a phone number that is retrieved by calling or . The phone number information is determined by the Interaction Center server by applying the dial plan information to a given phone number string to determine the normalized phone number for the Interaction Center system to make a call. Also, the IC system can determine if the phone number is local, long-distance, international, etc.
Explanation of each property
The input text.
The string that will be used by Interaction Center when dialing this phone numbers.
Descriptive text set for this type of phone number.
The string that can be presented to the user for editing this phone number.
The string that indicates the intercom extension, if this phone number is an extension. This would be empty if the PhoneNumber.RawText is not an intercom extension.
The default Phone number classification for this phone number.
Classifications that this phone number falls into.
Is this an internal number?
If this number matches an , then the type of the queue.
A valid scoped queue name if this number has a queue type.
Can this number receive voicemails?
Can this number be dialed?
Will the Interaction Center dial extension (if exists) while dialing this number?
When the method is called with an input string '8004562354', the properties of this class may look like this:
: 8004562354
: +18004562354
: (Tool Free) 1 (800) 456-2354
: 1 (800) 456-2354
:
: Tool Free
: Tool Free
: false
: None
:
: false
: true
: false
When the method is called with extension of a user, for ex., 6929, the properties of this class may look like this:
: 6929
: /6929
: 6929
:
: 6929
: Intercom
: Intercom
: true
: User
: User Queue:<userId>
: true
: true
: true
. .

member.name: P:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.PhoneNumber.DefaultClassification
member.summary: The default classification for this . There can be multiple .

remarks.para: Phone numbers that can be identified by a pattern in the numbers, or an explicit group of phone numbers with a common purpose are called phone number "classifications". For example, internal calls could be identified by the "Internal" classification, toll free (for example, 800 numbers) could be identified by the "Toll Free" classification, and calls to emergency services (such as 911, fire department, police, and hospital) could be identified by the "Emergency" classification.

When IC users dial a phone number, IC matches the number dialed with the appropriate classification pattern. It then checks the user's dialing privileges to determine if the user or station is authorized to place the call. In this way, IC uses phone number classifications to control individual users, workgroups, roles, and station dialing privileges.

When IC users dial a phone number, IC matches the number dialed with the appropriate classification pattern. member.summary: Represents a station's interactions.

member.name: F:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.QueueType.Workgroup
member.summary: Represents a workgroup's interactions. Interactions passed to a Workgroup queue can be picked up by its member agents.

member.name: F:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.QueueType.Orbit
member.summary: Represents an orbit queue's interactions. An orbit queue is a list of all calls parked to specific locations (numbered orbits). This feature is especially helpful for Public Announcement system operators who can park a call in Orbit, then page the recipient and relay that he or she has a call on a specific Orbit (i.e. "John Doe, you have a call on Orbit 12", thus enabling John Doe to move to any station and pick up the call).

member.name: F:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.QueueType.Line
member.summary: Represents a line's interactions. (This can be an expensive queue to watch.)

member.name: T:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.ScreenPop
member.summary: This class serves as the main interface for tracking when DDE screen pops occur.
member.remarks: A ScreenPop object is used to receive notifications when a DDE screen pop is received. Upon receipt the event is triggered if this ScreenPop object has watching turned on. Watching is turned on and off via the and functions. Screen pops are dde events that are triggered by the "Actions" item in Interaction Administrator.

member.name: T:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.SecureRecordingPauseAction
member.summary: Specifies the secure recording pause action that should be taken.

member.name: F:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.SecureRecordingPauseAction.None
member.summary: Performs no action.

member.name: F:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.SecureRecordingPauseAction.PauseWithDefaultTimeout
member.summary:
Pauses a secure recording with the default time specified in Interaction Administrator.
If a timed secure recording pause is already in effect then this will reset the pause timer to the default value in Interaction Administrator. Pauses are not cumulative, so if 10 seconds were remaining on a current pause and the default was set at 15 seconds, the recording would only be paused for 15 seconds following this request, not 25.

member.name: F:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.SecureRecordingPauseAction.PauseWithInfiniteTimeout
member.summary: Pauses a secure recording indefinitely.

member.name: F:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.SecureRecordingPauseAction.PauseWithSpecifiedTimeout
member.summary:
Pauses a secure recording for a specified time.
If a timed secure recording pause is already in effect then this will reset the pause timer to the specified value in Interaction Administrator. Pauses are not cumulative, so if 10 seconds were remaining on a current pause and 15 seconds were specified for this pause, the recording would only be paused for 15 seconds following this request, not 25.

member.name: F:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.SecureRecordingPauseAction.ResumeRecording
member.summary: Restarts a secure recording on the interaction if it was paused. If a secure recording is not paused, this action will have no effect and the recording will continue.

member.name: T:ININ.IceLib.Interactions.InteractionSegment
member.summary: A segment of an .
member.remarks: There are two types of segments: user segments and connection segments. User segments are segments associated to a user via a user queue. Connection segments are associated with a workgroup queue. For example, in a conference call, there is one connection segment which represents the conference, and a user segment for each party that joins the conference.
